p: Besides the disciplinary control by the governmental regulatory bodies, people should be cautious of the seriousness of the DENV infection. This can be done by the social awareness programs. Actually, because there is no specific medicine to mitigate the disease, an early diagnosis is stringently helpful [ 30]. The aqueous extract of Carica papaya leaves has been found to exhibit prospective remedies against dengue fever [ 31]. This can even eliminate the complications including death. According to the WHO, Bangladesh, aspirin and ibuprofen must be avoided in case of dengue fever because these medicines tend to increase the bleeding frequency and also stomachache. Rather, paracetamol is suggested only on the medical advice [ 30]. If the signs of DHF are noticed, the patient should be immediately transferred to the hospital. The infected person should drink fluids as much as possible [ 30].
